name: Norrønasongen Poetry Box! Limited to 120 Copies!
description:
The New Norse poetry cycle «Norrønasongen» is finally complete! To celebrate the event, I publish a box set limited to 120 copies through my micropublisher Propagenia Press.

The box consists of the three books «Trisyn» (2010), «Kosmopolis» (2011) and «Umgangskrigen» (2013). All books are signed first editions. The boxes are hand numbered. Will ship before November 15th. 

This is a rare object and a gift to someone appreciating epic Norwegian poetry. Please note that the books are written in so-called «høgnorsk», that is, an archaic-poetic version of Norwegian!

Design by Trine + Kim Design Studio.

The price includes shipping and handling world wide.

name: Solefald - Waves over Valhalla t-shirt - Beige
description:
A special Solefald Live t-shirt designed by Costin Chioreanu for the concert at Dark Bombastic Evening in Transilvania, August 2013. 

On the front is an art nouveau-inspired illustration for the track "Waves over Valhalla". On the back are the tour dates of Solefald's "Soundwaves over Europe 2013". This t-shirt thus serves both as a souvenir from our live campaign this year, and as a pointer to Solefald's only death metal song!

Colour: Beige. 

Shipping and handling world wide included in the price.

name: Solefald - Waves over Valhalla t-shirt - Olive green
description:
A special Solefald Live t-shirt designed by Costin Chioreanu for the concert at Dark Bombastic Evening in Transilvania, August 2013. 

On the front is an art nouveau-inspired illustration for the track "Waves over Valhalla". On the back are the tour dates of Solefald's "Soundwaves over Europe 2013". This t-shirt thus serves both as a souvenir from our live campaign this year, and as a pointer to Solefald's only death metal song!

Colour: Olive green. 

Shipping and handling world wide included in the price.

name: Solefald - "Solefald" t-shirt - old school grey on black
description:
This shirt displays the Theodor Kittelsen drawing that gave Solefald its name.The drawing adorned our "The Circular Drain" demo/remix album, and is now available as a t-shirt for the first time. Grey on black, old school style!

The front displays the sun as a Norse rider chasing the darkness. The back displays a poem by Cornelius Jakhelln, "Solefald", set to the drawing and written in Norwegian on September 15th, 1995. 

Note in passing: Solefald made their first 2000s live appearance exactly 17 years later, at the Southern Discomfort festival in Kristiansand, on 15.9.2012.

Designed by Trine + Kim Design Studio. 

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

name: Solefald + Vreid - Occupation of Berlin t-shirt - Limited! - White on black
description:
This is a t-shirt commemorating the Solefald/Vreid concert in Berlin on April 9th, 2013. The text claiming an occupation of Berlin, symbolised by the Brandenburg Gate, is an ironic pointer to the WWII German occupation of Norway on April 9th, 1940. Vreid also released their "MilOrg" album in Berlin on April 9th, 2009. 

The front of the t-shirt displays the logos of Solefald and Vreid, and the musical occupation of the Brandenburg Gate. The back displays the coat of arms of the 3rd Regiment Berlin. 

Design by Valnoir/Metastazis. This t-shirt is strictly limited edition and will not be reprinted!

Shipping and handling world wide included in the price.

name: G.U.T. - Persona de Paris - Demo CD limited to 100!
description:
The first demo in the new Inhuman Music Demo Series, G.U.T.'s "Persona de Paris" contains four unpublished songs written and recorded in Paris in 1999/2000. Dark and experimental electronica that would later merge into G.U.T., a project that made its debut on Inhuman Music in the Spring of 2007.

The cd slipcase is made of recycled paper and stamped with the insignia of the 3rd Inhuman Music Regiment Berlin. 

Limited to 100 copies signed and numbered by hand! 

Four new Deject/Destroy/Damage/Delay versions of the tracks!

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

Track list: 

1. 19991
2. 19992
3. 19993
4. 19994
5. 19991 (2011 Deject)
6. 19992 (2011 Destroy)
7. 19993 (2011 Damage)
8. 19994 (2011 Delay)

name: Solefald - Norrøn Livekunst T-shirt
description: Concert T-shirt with the cover design of Solefald's "Norrøn livskunst" album. The title reads "Norrøn livekunst", or "Norse Live Art" - as opposed to the album title "Norse Art of Living"! Pressed for Solefald's first live gig in Kristiansand, September 15th 2012. High quality print on heavy Fruit of the Loom cotton t-shirts. Design: Trine & Kim. Shipping world wide included in the price.

name: Sturmgeist - Walpurgisnacht - Demo CD limited to 100!
description:
The second demo in the new Inhuman Music Demo Series, Sturmgeist's "Walpurgisnacht" contains three songs that would later make it onto the two first Sturmgeist albums "Meister Mephisto" and "Über". Previously unreleased!

Track list: 
1. Rattenfänger
2. Walpurgisnacht
3. Meister Mephisto

The demo was recorded in Kristiansand with drummer Yngve Jacobsen in the fall of 2002, and later completed in Paris in early 2003. "Walpurgisnacht" sounds eerie and necro, stripped of synths and with a raw demo edge. 

The cd slipcase is made of recycled paper and stamped with the insignia of the 3rd Inhuman Music Regiment Berlin. 

Limited to 100 copies signed and numbered by hand! 

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

name: Sturmgeist - "Manifesto Futurista"
description:
"MANIFESTO FUTURISTA" PRESS RELEASE 

Sturmgeist - "Manifesto Futurista"
Norwegian Black Metal
Inhuman Music 003

Sturmgeist was formed in 2003 by Cornelius von Jackhelln, founding member of Avant-Black pioneers Solefald. During his four-year stay at the Sorbonne university in Paris, von Jackhelln, a Norwegian citizen with remote German origins, developed a strong interest in his own identity and culture. The Sturmgeist name, meaning "stormspirit" in German, was inspired by Goethe's ballads from the "Sturm und Drang" era. 

In "Manifesto Futurista" Sturmgeist explores the aesthetics of early 20th-century Futurism. "There is no masterpiece that has not an aggressive character," F.T. Marinetti wrote in 1909. Exactly one century later, it is only appropriate to commemorate Futurism with the song "Manifesto Futurista", a blazing anthem to speed and technology. However, also the darkest moments of last century are treated. The song "Verdun" tells the destiny of a young soldier in WWI, whereas the French lyric "Elégie d'une modernité meurtrière" describes a Genesis gone wrong, the creation of Man by God and Man's subsequent creation of industrial death camps. 

"Manifesto Futurista" contains four poems from von Jackhelln's book "Galderhug/Spellmind" (bilingual Norwegian/English edition, Cappelen Damm publishers, 2008). Also a writer, von Jackhelln's bibliography counts six titles exploring the crash between Norse mythology and contemporary culture. In 2007 Von Jackhelln won the Bonnier-Cappelen publishing group's Great Nordic Novel Competition with the saga "The Fall of the Gods", landing him massive media attention, translations into three languages and a considerable prize sum. 

On November 7th, 2007, Sturmgeist got the worst phone call a musician can get: a news reporter stated that a young Finn using "Sturmgeist89" as his YouTube login had killed nine people, including himself, at his high school in Jokela. As a result, Sturmgeist considered giving up music entirely. When confronted with such an example of real evil, the extreme metal fascination with imaginary evil seemed shallow and shameful. However, Sturmgeist decided to persevere. Giving the critics right would be equal to admitting guilt for a crime committed by a deranged kid alien to the band. In a press release the same day, von Jackhelln retorted that "although extreme metal as a genre deals with topics such as isolation, misanthropy and despair, blaming the musicians is both wrong and unfair. It is people that kill people. Not music." The furious song "Sturmgeist_89" is a message from the real Sturmgeist, with the short question "Why did you do it?" as its desperate chorus. 

When Sturmgeist now returns after three years of silence, it is with an album that screams with fury and vengeance. Sturmgeist has adopted the extreme expression of Norwegian Black Metal and evolved beyond the eclectic Black/Thrash/Industrial style of the band's two previous albums, "Meister Mephisto" and "Über" (Season of Mist, 2005 & 2006). Centered around blitzing blastbeats, shattering riffs and hellish screams, "Manifesto Futurista" is the angriest and most intense album ever recorded by Von Jackhelln. 

The album cover displays Norwegian artist Pushwagner's monumental work "Dadadata I". "Manifesto Futurista" was recorded in desolate surroundings in Sofia and Berlin, and masterfully mixed by Stamos Koliousis and Vangelis Labrakis at 210 Studios. Released on Sturmgeist's own Berlin-based Inhuman Music under the motto "I speak of war but pray for peace", "Manifesto Futurista" is set to enthuse and to infuriate, to alienate and to arouse. 

The CD is a six-page digipack with a booklet featuring lyrics and poems, limited to 1000 copies and signed by hand.

Track list:

1. Monolith
2. Himmelen faller
3. The Siegfried Order
4. Skyggestrykerne
5. Verdun
6. Elégie d'une modernité meurtrière
7. Ritorno glorioso
8. Manifesto futurista
9. Sturmgeist_89
10. Let Us Be the Suns of our Time
11. Death Metal Baroque (hidden track)

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

name: PDF - GewaltKunstWerk Catalogue / Third Rebel Think Tank Proceedings
description:
"Art is war & the sacred calling of the artist as soldier & fighter in the world of symbols.  
Art is everything we can get away with. Art is what we are willing to die for."

The catalogue for the GewaltKunstWerk exhibition in Kristiansand Kunsthall - but also the first book from Propagenia Press, featuring new essays by Avi Pitchon, Dominik Irtenkauf & Gunnar Sauermann for the Third Rebel seminar: "Musical Extremism: Anti-semitism, Nazism & Terror in Neofolk, Industrial & Black Metal." The book is magisterially designed by Valnoir/Metastazis.

GewaltKunstWerk is a project bringing artists from opposite camps to- gether, with retrogarde painters facing artists of the avantgarde. The one common denominator for GewaltKunstWerk is, as the title implies, the work of art as a vehicle for destructive & violent forces, be it erosion, oblivion or war between nations, groups or individuals. 

The icing on the cake is the Third Rebel Proceedings 2010-2012 - a think tank dedicated to the dark arts, established by Cornelius von Jackhelln in 2010 - featuring exchanges on monumental aesthetics, industrial, black metal, fascism etc. Among the Third Rebel contributors are Zweizz, Avi Pitchon, Gunnar Sauermann, Dominik Irtenkauf, Valnoir plus lots of talent from the European avantgarde metal scenes.

From the preface: "What you will witness in the Third Rebel Proceedings is a discussion that has been going on for almost two years. The Third Rebel mailing list was founded as a musical and lyrical think tank within a military structure. The members of Third Rebel hail from different professions, cultures and nations, but share a passion for listening to & reflecting on dark & extreme music. Think of our everlasting chat as a tv series popu- lated by nerds with a love/hate relationship to totalitarian aesthetics & the sublime, or as a stand-up cabaret with geese pitching bronze-coloured lines for the sake of rhetoric." 

The PDF will be sent to you by email upon payment of the order.

Free shipping world wide is included in the price.

name: Solefald - Norrøn livskunst CD+LP
description:
Our long awaited seventh studio album is here! Excellent critics are pouring in, and I am happy to offer a signed version of the album - by both members! 

Track list:

01. Song til Stormen
02. Norrøn livskunst
03. Tittentattenteksti
04. Stridsljod / Blackabilly
05. Eukalyptustreet 
06. Raudedauden
07. Vitets vidd i verdi
08. Hugferdi
09. Waves Over Vallhalla (An Icelandic Odyssey Part 3)
10. Til heimen yver havet

«The eighth instalment in Norwegian duo Solefald’s multistoried career, Norrøn Livskunst, once again raises the insanity stakes while sounding like nothing else you’ve ever heard.» 
Edwin McFee, Metal Hammer UK

«This amazing writing, the vocal performances and the unique approach to metal is what makes Solefald such an incredible band. And the material on this record is as good as anything else they’ve ever produced and definitely up there with any other record that I’ve heard this year and fans of the band’s last two records will definitely be pleased to hear a third installment in the Icelandic Odyssey series (which rules). Norrøn Livskunst is a record that I recommend not just to fans but to anyone who is interested in unique metal with an eye towards aesthetics and norm bending. I wish more metal musicians were as willing to take all their influences and work them into their records like Solefald is; the scene would be a much more interesting and innovative place.»
- angrymetalguy.com (rating 5.0/5.0 - Fuck yes. Record o’the Month November 2010)

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price. All shipments containing LPs are registered and insured, and come with a tracking number.

name: Solefald "Norrøn livskunst CD" + Three-CD label Pack: Solefald, Sturmgeist & G.U.T.
description:
This offer consists of Solefald's "Norrøn livskunst" jewelcase CD + all three CD releases of Inhuman Music:

name: Three-CD label Pack: Solefald - "The Circular Drain", Sturmgeist - "Manifesto Futurista" & G.U.T. -
description:

Sturmgeist - "Manifesto Futurista" digipack CD, limited to 1000 copies

G.U.T. - "My Only Drug Is Madness" jewelcase CD, limited to 1000 copies

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

name: Solefald - "The Circular Drain"
description:
In the liner notes of "The Linear Scaffold" we audaciously announced a follow-up by the name "The Circular Drain" - that features the "Jernlov" demo from 1996, available on cd for the first time. Four songs of total screaming madness. 300 numbered tapes of the demo were printed in 1996. The demo sold out quickly and has been unavailable ever since. "Jernlov" has been remastered by Endre Kirkesola and sounds pretty much like Solefald gone necro.

Furthermore, "The Circular Drain" includes remixes of several Solefald faves. Havoc Unit has remixed "Sun I Call" quite beautifully; The Bombs of Enduring Freedom has given "Survival of the Outlaw" the bigbeat aggression it needed; Newcomer Exorcise offers a breathtaking version of "Red for Fire + Black for Death"; Lazare has finally remixed his favourite track "Fluorescent" (he has been fantasising about that since we recorded "Neonism" in 1998); I [Cornelius] have recorded a semi-unplugged version of "When The Moon Is On The Wave" as G.U.T. Check out the tracklist below for all the details. 

The cd is a 6-page digipack designed by Trine Paulsen and Kim Sølve, who have done Solefald's last four releases. The front cover should be a surprise: It features the Theodor Kittelsen drawing that gave "Solefald" our name. 

I will personally sign and number every cd by hand. Along with the cd I will also send you a hand-printed card from an old-fashioned Berlin typographer stating that you belong to the Solefald hardcore of fanatics. Your red certificate will carry beautiful German gothic fonts, and I will add your name and the number of your cd by hand. 

Being number seven in our discography "The Circular Drain" is an official Solefald release. 

Track list: 

JERNLOV - THE IRON LAW 

Solefald Demonstration Tape - 996 AF 

1. Motmenneske 
2. Philosophical Revolt 
3. Sivilisasjonens Slør - Ravnens Fall 
4. When The Moon Is On The Wave 

THE CIRCULAR DRAIN - DET SYKLISKE SLUK 

Solefald Remixes & Free Mixes 

5. Red For Fire + Black For Death - Exorcise 
6. Survival Of Fhe Outlaw - The Bombs Of Enduring Freedom 
7. Fluorescent (The Total Orchestra) - dj:!!j Lazare 
8. Sun I Call - Havoc Unit 
9. There Is Need - The Extreme Zweizz Fuckover 
10. CK II Chanel no 6 - Half Sherman 
11. A Motion Picture - Red Sector A 
12. Bragi (Prayer Of A Son) - Havoc Unit 
13. When The Moon Is On The Wave - G.U.T. 

The total playing time is approximately one hour. 

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.

name: Solefald - Black for Death T-shirt
description: Solefald T-shirt with the cover design of "Black for Death". Bone cross on the back. High quality print on heavy cotton shirts from Fruit of the Loom. Design: Trine & Kim. Shipping world wide included in the price.

name: Norrøn Livekunst + Black for Death T-shirt pack
description: Norrøn Livekunst and Black for Death T-shirts at the size of your choice. High quality print on heavy Fruit of the Loom shirts. Design: Trine & Kim. Shipping world wide included in the price. Please include information about which sizes you desire in the order.

name: G.U.T. - "My Only Drug Is Madness"
description:
Lyrics from "My Only Drug Is Madness"

Music is the way I share what I have seen
My only drug is madness my bloodstream is clean
Why do you need powder to behave like a star
I say like Kurt Cobain, come as you are

We want to be loved to be worshipped as gods
We sell our asses to be ridiculed as sods
An artist should live forgotten abroad
Away from TV and the celebrity fraud

I travel the world but haven't seen much
The visions I have come through the sense of touch
So this is my fate telling stories to the beat
Sculpted in the hall where sound and meaning meet

I am no media star, communication breakdown,
This is aimed at the ether of the underground.
Ape’s my existence and ape’s my excuse,
If you’ve never suffered I can take the abuse.

Track list:
1. Balkanized In Belgrade
2. Home Of The Hardcore
3. Transilvanian Hunger
4. Représailles À Versailles
5. First Song Last Chance
6. Mastur Bator
7. The Beauty & The Bitch
8. Unconquered Sun
9. My Only Drug Is Madness
10. Nein Nein Zeppelin

G.U.T. is the zoological garden of my mind, where scores of weird beasts run around in frenzy and freedom. Since 1999 I have been writing electronica-based songs, and in August 2005 I finally committed myself to making a full album. For that purpose I rented the Graffitti Studio in Sofia, Bulgaria for four weeks' worth of studio time. Working in a wholly new country with new people turned into a genuine pleasure, given the resolute professionalism of the Graffitti crew. Ognian Kiossovski engineered the recording sessions. The Bulgarian composer and conductor Christo Pavlov arranged six of the G.U.T. songs for the Strrings (sic!) Quartet. After a rather quiet year with some additional vocal takes and editing by the sea in Kragerø, Norway, I received a generous grant from the Cultiva Express trust in Kristiansand, sponsoring the mixing of the album. Consequently I asked the mixer Endre Kirkesola at Dub Studio to board ship. The album "My Only Drug Is Madness" was released through my own label, Inhuman Music, in May 2007. 

After ten years of working with various well-established record labels, I decided to go solo. Being the total-control anarchist that I am, I wanted to experience the whole process of writing, performing, producing, publishing, promoting and financing an album, addressed to the people that really matter: the fanatics that enjoy my music. You will see no magazine ads for the album, and only a handful of reviews, if any. The release of "My Only Drug Is Madness" is an experiment in order to know if and how self-publication works. The album is available from my mail-order company in Berlin, as well as from Twilight Distribution (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), Indie Distribution (Norway), Season of Mist (France) and CDBaby (USA). I pressed 1000 hand-numbered and signed copies of the album. 

A number of skilled people contributed to the G.U.T. process. Tori Wrånes, Olav Benestvedt and Simen Høgdal Pedersen kindly lent their voices. Christo Pavlov's arrangements and the Strrings' performance give the songs an orchestral sheen. Donny of the Bulgarian pop combo Popcorn brought his armada of synthesizers to the studio (among which a Soviet RITM 2 and a German Vermona stood out), doing sound replacements and occasional key contributions.

Shipping and handling world wide is included in the price.
